adm:property.name: allowed-client
adm:property.adm:synopsis: This property specifies a set of address masks that may be used to determine the addresses of the clients that are allowed to establish connections to this connection handler.

adm:none.adm:synopsis: Changes to this configuration attribute will take effect immediately but will not interfere with connections that may already be established.

adm:alias.adm:synopsis: All clients with addresses that do not match an address on the deny list will be allowed. If there is no deny list, then all clients will be allowed.

adm:property.name: denied-client
adm:property.adm:synopsis: This property specifies a set of address masks that may be used to determine the addresses of the clients that are not allowed to establish connections to this connection handler.
adm:property.adm:description: If both allowed and denied client masks are defined and a client connection matches one or more masks in both lists, then the connection will be denied. If only a denied list is specified, then any client not matching a mask in that list will be allowed.

adm:none.adm:synopsis: Changes to this configuration attribute will take effect immediately but will not interfere with connections that may already be established.

adm:alias.adm:synopsis: If an allow list is specified, then only clients with addresses on the allow list will be allowed. Otherwise, all clients will be allowed.
